change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Questionnaires, working notes and assembled data related to Rasmussen's 1960-1961 interviews with 65 activists of the British Liberal Party. Each questionnaire gives the interviewee's name, personal and biographical information, and political views.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Retrenchment and Revival Source Material (MS 095). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Educator and author; associated with the University of Wisconsin and the University of Arizona.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 2 series, alphabetically arranged by respondent.

list.item: Series I: Assembled data and questionnaires, 1960-1961

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Questionnaires, working notes and assembled data related to Rasmussen's 1960-1961 interviews with 65 activists of the British Liberal Party. Each questionnaire gives the interviewee's name, personal and biographical information, and political views.

relatedmaterial.p: This research was published in Retrenchment and Revival: A Study of the Contemporary British Liberal Party, published by the University of Arizona Press in 1964.
